commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Greet
Add horizontal line method and implement in level 0
Remove Line() (line 14) and add in printHorizontalLine method at the end
Imported scanner class to receive user input
Remove redundant return statement in printHorizontalLine method
Implemented checkInput method so the bot knows how to respond to the different inputs (echo it or respond with bye message)
Added 2 new methods * addToList * listInputs
commitResults.messageBody:
addToList allows the bot to store and track user's inputs
listInputs have yet to be implemented

checkInputs method currently only checked for 2 kinds of inputs

The current level requires to bot to be able to perform 3 actions

if else statements have been added to check for the 3 kinds of inputs

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Added 2 new methods"
commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit 231df5770ef7d9de02cadadb7fa280b2ade00fa4.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement addToList method and update checkInput method
commitResults.messageBody:
The current bot can only echo user inputs

Current level requires bot to store user's inputs

addToList method allows the bot to store user inputs in an ArrayList

ArrayList was chosen as the list can be resized easily

checkInputs method currently only checked for 2 kinds of inputs

The current level requires to bot to be able to perform 3 actions

if else statements have been added to check for the 3 kinds of inputs

commitResults.messageTitle: Complete Level-2
commitResults.messageBody:
Current bot can only store user's inputs.

To complete Level-2 requirements, bot needs to list all user inputs.

listInputs method implemented to list all user inputs using a for loop.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename inputs to task
commitResults.messageBody:
Bot acts as a to do list.

Renaming inputs to task where appropriate
increases code readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Task Class
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks were managed by methods in Main.

A task class is created to manage all tasks as objects.

Creating a new class allows for more abstraction and follows the convention of OOP.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Task class in Level-1 code
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods were used to handle the operations of tasks.

Task class is created and used to manage the operations of task.

Using class provides greater abstraction and follows the OOP convention.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Implement Task class in Level-1 code"
commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit 76bdf215b2b73838aff7a6d2e6c0d70fa72d490c.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Task class in Level-2 code
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods were used to handle the operations of tasks.

Task class is created and used to manage the operations of task.

Using class provides greater abstraction and follows the OOP convention.

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace String with Task to fix bug
Add extra checkers in checkInput method
commitResults.messageBody:
Current bot can only check for list or bye.

To fulfil Level-3 requirements, more checks need to be added.

Additional if else statements were added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update listTasks Method
commitResults.messageBody:
Current listTasks cannot show whether task is completed.

Add an if else statement to check if task is completed
and print corresponding output.

commitResults.messageTitle: Shift tasks related methods from main class to task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods related to Tasks should not be kept in main.

Move tasks related methods from Main.java to Task.java.

This better follows the convention of OOP.

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace if else statements with switch
commitResults.messageBody:
Current code uses if else statements to help bot make a decision.

Replace if else statements with switch.

The if else chunk can grow to become very large.
Using switch can increase the readability of the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Complete requirements for level 3
commitResults.messageBody:
Bot is unable to print correct output for user input "mark" and "unmark".

Add correct outputs to the code and use setStatus method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve readability and refactoring
commitResults.messageBody:
Current code has magic numbers and duplicate methods that
accomplish the same task of checking for input
It was also not at the same level of abstraction

Consolidate Duplicate Conditional Fragments by removing
the switch statement in the main method. This also removed the
magic numbers that were in the main method.
Refactor code by extracting method as the println statements
from the marking and unmarking of tasks can be grouped together.

This is done according to the SE best practices of improving
readability and refactoring

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Todo Class which is a child of Task Class
commitResults.messageBody:
To meet Level-4 requirements, a Todo class is needed to
handle Todo type tasks.

Create a Todo Class as a child of the Task Class as it is a
subset of the Task Class.

This follows OOP best practices of inheritance and
polymorphism.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Deadline Class which is a child of Task Class
commitResults.messageBody:
To meet Level-4 requirements, a Deadline class is needed to
handle Deadline type tasks.

Create a Deadline Class as a child of the Task Class as it is a
subset of the Task Class.

This follows OOP best practices of inheritance and
polymorphism.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Event Class which is a child of Task Class
commitResults.messageBody:
To meet Level-4 requirements, a Event class is needed to
handle Event type tasks.

Create a Event Class as a child of the Task Class as it is a
subset of the Task Class.

This follows OOP best practices of inheritance and
polymorphism.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code using Extract Method
commitResults.messageBody:
Current code has 3 println statements per task type.

Refactor code using Extract method by putting the 3 println statements
into a separate method whose name explains the purpose of
the println statements.

Improves the quality of the code by improving code structure.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow Duke to handle exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke is operating in an ideal world where there are no invalid inputs.

Users might not input commands in the correct format and Duke
needs to be able to handle it these exceptions

Add Duke Exceptions class to handle the various exceptions that can
occur when a user uses Duke. Duke will print an error message when
user inputs a task type that it does not recognise.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle exceptions related to the todo task
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke is unable to handle incorrect user commands related to the
different task types. if the command is not formatted correctly, Duke
will crash.

Add exceptions to check that user has inputted the name of the todo
task in the correct format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete function to Duke Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke chatbot is unable to delete tasks added previously.

Add method to delete task in Task class and add a case "delete"

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Add delete function to Duke Chatbot"
commitResults.messageBody: This reverts commit 94d5563f05a647fa7b4de91d0cc7e90d46e37012.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete function to Duke Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke chatbot is unable to delete tasks added previously.

Add method to delete task in Task class and add a case "delete"

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality and standards
Add read file function to Duke Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke is unable to save and read previous user inputs.
With initialiseDuke method, Duke can read previous user inputs
or create a new file to store inputs if this is the user's first time

Duke uses Java.io.File package for this function

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow Duke to save tasks inputted by user to hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke can only read from duke.txt if it exists in hard disk
and add into its ArrayList.

Use File and FileWriter packages to allow Duke to save
user input into hard disk

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-6:
  Add delete function to Duke Chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody:

  Allow Duke to save tasks inputted by user to hard disk
  Add read file function to Duke Chatbot

#	src/main/java/Event.java

resolve conflicts

commitResults.messageTitle: Create more classes to focus on OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement classes Parser, Storage, TaskList and UI

Improves code quality and standard according to OOP guidelines

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement find function in Duke chat bot
commitResults.messageBody:
Add method to find keyword that user inputted and
check if the keyword is in any task and print task if
present.

commitResults.messageBody: Level-9

commitResults.messageBody: Add user guide

Merge pull request #2 from Thiolk/branch-A-JavaDoc

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow Duke to save the status of the task and to update saved file when the task list is updated
Allow Duke ChatBot to update saved data when user uses the mark, unmark or delete command
Change saved file path to fix bug where the file path cannot be found on a windows computer
Fix bugs in Duke ChatBot
